page.title: 10Religion
page.content: The Church of Wales is represented by two church buildings;St. Mary's Church in Monk Street and Holy Trinity Church in Baker Street.The original Church of St. Mary was the church of a Bene- dictine priory established during the reign of Henry I (1100 - 1135). Roman Catholics attend the Church of Our Lady and St.Michael. The Baptist Church on the corner of Pen-y-Pound and Frogmore Street reminds us that the first Baptist Acadamy in Wales was established in Abergavenny. The Whitefield Presbyterian Church in Pen-y-Pound is evidence of the early Calvinist influence in Abergavenny. Also to be found in Abergavenny are a United Reform Church,a Methodist Church,a Christadelphian Church, a Salvation Army Citadel,an Assemblies of God Church and a Gospel Hall.
